prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
The infant experienced a heart failure at the park on Thursday

A female has been detained on suspicion of disregarding a five-month-old male who underwent a heart failure at a park.

The child is in a severe state in the hospital after the incident at Windsor's Legoland at around 13:00 BST on Thursday, the police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Essex's Witham, was detained on suspicion of mistreating a child to cause needless harm.

She has been released on bond until July 26.

Zoe Eele, a police detective from Thames Valley's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "First and foremost, our thoughts are with the family of the young man who is in a severe state in the hospital after having a heart failure.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was waiting in line for the Coastguard HQ boat tour between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid conjecture about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

The police said they are not searching for other suspects in connection with the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.

A woman was arrested in connection with the incident on suspicion of child mistreatment after a 5-month-old boy experienced a heart failure at a park on Thursday.

The infant remains in a serious state in the hospital after the incident at Legoland in Windsor at around 13:00 BST on Thursday, according to the police.

The suspect, a 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of mistreating a child to cause needless harm.

She has been released on bail until July 26.

Detective Zoe Eele from Thames Valley's Child Abuse Investigation Unit said: "First and foremost, our thoughts are with the family of the young boy who is in a serious condition in hospital following a heart failure.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was waiting in line for the Coastguard HQ boat tour between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid conjecture about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply distressing time."

The police said they are not searching for other suspects in connection with the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

On Thursday, a five-month-old boy from Witham, Essex, was taken ill while at Legoland Windsor. His condition is critical and he remains in hospital.

A 27-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of child mistreatment and has been bailed until July 26. She was arrested after the boy suffered a cardiac arrest at the park.

Detective Zoe Eele from Thames Valley's Child Abuse Investigation Unit said: "Our thoughts are with the boy's family. We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who were waiting in line for the Coastguard HQ boat tour between around 11.30am and 12:45pm."

The theme park said: "Our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

On Thursday, a five-month-old boy from Essex suffered a heart attack while visiting Legoland Windsor Resort. The boy was taken to the hospital and is currently in critical condition.

The boy's 27-year-old mother was arrested on suspicion of child abuse and later released on bail until July 26th. She was detained following the incident at the park.

Detective Zoe Eele of the Thames Valley Child Abuse Investigation Unit said, "Our thoughts are with the baby's family. We are working closely with the Legoland Windsor Resort team, but we would like to speak to anyone who were waiting in line for the Coastguard HQ boat tour between 11:30 a.m. and 12:45 p.m."

The theme park added, "Our fully trained first aid team provided immediate care until emergency services arrived. We will continue to support the Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
